metadata.title: Bob Woodward's Trump book: Author details aides' worries about Trump - CNNPolitics
metadata.ogTitle: Bob Woodward: Trump's aides stole his papers 'to protect the country'
metadata.twitterTitle: Bob Woodward: Trump's aides stole his papers 'to protect the country'
metadata.ogDescription: President Donald Trump's closest aides have taken extraordinary measures in the White House to try to stop what they saw as his most dangerous impulses, going so far as to swipe and hide papers from his desk so he wouldn't sign them, according to a new book from legendary journalist Bob Woodward.

nodes.title: Rohingya protesters call for freedom for Reuters reporters in Myanmar
nodes.cleanedCompare: rohingya muslim refugees gathered muddy sports field camp bangladesh wednesday protest conviction myanmar reuters reporters arrested covering plight community protesters call freedom

metadata.title: Rohingya protesters call for freedom for Reuters reporters in Myanmar | Reuters
metadata.description: About 50 Rohingya Muslim refugees gathered in a muddy sports field in a camp in Bangladesh on Wednesday to protest against the conviction in Myanmar of two Reuters reporters, who were arrested while covering the plight of their community.

nodes.title: Myanmar official says 'totally underestimated' economic impact of Rohingya crisis
nodes.cleanedCompare: myanmar foreign investment official wednesday totally underestimated economic damage rohingya crisis adding outcry jailing reuters reporters impact country's reputation

metadata.title: Myanmar official says 'totally underestimated' economic impact of Rohingya crisis | Reuters
metadata.description: A Myanmar foreign investment official said on Wednesday he "totally underestimated" the economic damage of the Rohingya crisis, adding that the outcry over the jailing of two Reuters reporters would also have some impact on his country's reputation.

nodes.title: Kremlin says puzzled by UK's decision to name Skripal case suspects
nodes.cleanedCompare: kremlin aide yuri ushakov wednesday hard understand britain signal moscow naming men suspected poisoning russian agent sergei skripal daughter yulia puzzled uk's decision case suspects

metadata.title: Kremlin says puzzled by UK's decision to name Skripal case suspects | Reuters
metadata.description: Kremlin aide Yuri Ushakov said on Wednesday that it was hard to understand what Britain was trying to signal to Moscow by naming two men it suspected of poisoning former Russian agent Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia.
metadata.keywords: US,BRITAIN,RUSSIA,KREMLIN,USHAKOV,Crime / Law / Justice,Russia,Western Europe,CIS Countries,Diplomacy / Foreign Policy,Crime,Government / Politics,General News,Major News,Europe,United Kingdom,International / National Security

nodes.title: 2 Russians suspected in poisoning of ex-spy, his daughter
nodes.cleanedCompare: british police wednesday named suspects russian nationals poisoning spy daughter salisbury march russians suspected ex-spy

metadata.title: British government names 2 Russian nationals as suspects in Salisbury poisonings - ABC News
metadata.description: British police Wednesday named two suspects, both Russian nationals, in the poisoning of a former Russian spy and his daughter in Salisbury in March.
metadata.keywords: chemical weapons, conspiracies, Sergei Skripal, police, Alexander Petrov, espionage, children, United Kingdom government, attempted crime, Russia, international news, world news, foreign news

nodes.title: Shells hit Syria's Idlib as rebels brace for assault
nodes.cleanedCompare: syrian military shelled stronghold active rebellion president bashar al-assad wednesday war monitor insurgents blew bridge anticipation government offensive shells hit syria's idlib rebels brace assault

metadata.title: Shells hit Syria's Idlib as rebels brace for assault | Reuters
metadata.description: The Syrian military shelled the last stronghold of active rebellion against President Bashar al-Assad on Wednesday as a war monitor said insurgents blew up another bridge in anticipation of a government offensive.

nodes.title: UK charges two Russians for attempted murder of Skripals, blames Moscow
nodes.cleanedCompare: britain charged russians wednesday attempted murder russian spy daughter describing suspects military intelligence officers acting behalf state uk charges skripals blames

metadata.title: UK charges two Russians for attempted murder of Skripals, blames Moscow | Reuters
metadata.description: Britain charged two Russians on Wednesday with the attempted murder of a former Russian spy and his daughter, describing the suspects as military intelligence officers almost certainly acting on behalf of the Russian state.
